metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40569 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to an Out-Of-Bounds Write in the `progressive_decompress` function. This issue is likely down to incorrect calculations of the `nXSrc` and `nYSrc` variables. This issue has been addressed in versions 2.11.0 and 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised to upgrade. there are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libuwac0-0 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
winpr-utils - 2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.10.0+dfsg1-1.1ubuntu1').
